SX0177/23 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFMN/NICE/COTE EXPERIMENTATION OF 4 INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURES TO FACILITATE OPTIMIZED DESCENTS. VALIDITY: 05OCT23 - 17APR24 THIS AIP SUP CONCERNS THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT OF OPTIMIZED DESCENT PROFILES ON THE INITIAL APPROACHES (INA = INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURE) OF FLIGHTS INBOUND FOR NICE COTE D AZUR (LFMN). AN OPTIMIZED DESCENT MEANS A DESCENT WITH REDUCED FUEL CONSUMPTION AND NOISE POLLUTION (TO DESCEND CONTINUOUSLY, TO THE GREATEST POSSIBLE EXTENT, BY EMPLOYING MINIMUM ENGINE THRUST, IDEALLY IN A LOW DRAG CONFIGURATION, PRIOR TO THE FINAL APPROACH POINT). THROUGHOUT THE VALIDITY PERIOD OF THIS AIP SUP, AND WHEN CONDITIONS ALLOW (TRAFFIC, WEATHER, ETC.), THE CONTROLLER USES THE PROCEDURES PUBLISHED IN ORDER TO LIMIT RADAR VECTORING. THE CREWS, WITH THE INFORMATION OF THE DISTANCE REMAINING TO THE RUNWAY MUST PERFORM OPTIMIZED DESCENTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT WILL TAKE PLACE AT ANY TIME (DAY OR NIGHT), DURING LIGHT TRAFFIC SITUATION, ONCE THE AIRCRAFT HAS BEEN TRANSFERRED TO NICE APP. IF THE TRAFFIC SITUATION DOES NOT ALLOW THE USE OF THE TRAJECTORIES,THE PILOT SHOULD EXPECT RADAR VECTORING TOWARDS THE INITIAL FIX OF THE PROCEDURE IN USE. RNAV(GNSS) PROCEDURES: RWY04R RAPOT1M/1N RWY04L LEMPU1M/1N RWY04L/R BISBO1M/1N RWY22L/R SOTOX1M/1N
